document.masterDocTitle: A key to species of the genus Hylaeus (Hymenoptera: Colletidae) from mainland of China with descriptions of new species and new records

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A key to species of the genus Hylaeus (Hymenoptera: Colletidae) from mainland of China with descriptions of new species and new records

heading.emphasis:
Key to species of genus
Hylaeus
from mainland of China

subSubSection.paragraph:
Key to subgenera of
Hylaeus
based on Dathe (1980, 2000). Male is unknown for
H . medialis Morawitz
and female is unknown for
H . sinensis Dathe.

paragraph.keyLead: 2. Apical lobe of S7 simple with smooth margin, hairs absent or sparse and confined to lateral part of proximal lobe; scape usually slender; labrum and mandible frequently with yellow spots [subgenus H. (Paraprosopis) Popov]..........................................................................................................................................3

- Apical lobe of S7 pectinate ( Fig. 2 ); scape commonly conically dilated or flattened, but if slender, then sternal callosity on S3 or lateral fringe of T1 absent; labrum and mandible black [subgenus
H. ( Hylaeus )
Fabricius].....................................................................................................................................................4

3. Middle of frons (above antennal sockets) smooth, shiny; scape conspicuously broadened, hairs on scape long; marks on pronotal collar yellow ............................................
H. (Paraprosopis) concinnus Cockerell

- Middle of frons punctate; scape slightly broadened, hairs on scape very short or absent; pronotal collar black...........................................................................................
H. (Paraprosopis) nigricallosus Morawitz

4. Apical half of gonoforceps short, its apex with distinct process curved medially ( Fig. 1 ); gonobase long, conical; genitalia large.........................................................................
H. (Hylaeus) difformis (Eversmann)

5. Scutum with two white marks .............................................................
H. (Hylaeus) przewalskyi Morawitz
7. Marks on lateral face, supraclypeal area, pronotal collar and tegula white or yellow.................................8
- Lateral face, supraclypeal area, pronotal collar and tegula black................................................................9

8. Middle of frons shiny and smooth; marks on body white; marks on paraocular area extending beyond the level of the upper margin of the antennal socket, supraclypeal area white. .................................................. ...................................................................................................................
H. (Hylaeus) potanini Morawitz

- Middle of frons punctate; marks on body yellow; marks on paraocular area not reaching level of the lower margin of the antennal socket; lower portion of supraclypeal area yellow, upper portion of it black........... .......................................................................................................................
H. (Hylaeus) paulus Bridwell

10. Malar area elongate, square or length slightly shorter than width
H. (Hylaeus ) dolichocephalus Morawitz

11. Middle of face (portion below and beside antennal socket) deeply concave .......
H. (Hylaeus) dorni Dathe

13. Inner eye margin with a conspicuous line of hairs; hair-bands on apical half of metasomal terga wide, dense, but medially interrupted.............................................................
H. (Hylaeus) mongolicus Morawitz

14. Ratio between head length: width more than one........................................
H. (Hylaeus) sibiricus (Strand)

15. Marks on body white, penis valves obviously exceeding gonoforceps
H. (Hylaeus) asiaticus (Dalla Torre)

16. S8 with prolonged basal part and apical process, the latter with short hairs or hairless and hooked downward; scape broadened, shield-like; paraocular area lacking transverse flat impressions............................. ............................................................................................................
H. (Lambdopsis) pfankuchi (Alfken)

- S8 more or less rhombiform, with short basal and apical parts, or apical process, if elongated, then with hairs and not hooked; S6 rounded or emarginated; scape slender or conically enlarged, or if scutiform, then face with flat transverse impressions on paraocular area and below antennal socket.......................17

17. Penis valves in dorsal view gently bent so that between them can be seen a pair of acute or truncate spines, these being ventral projections of penis valves ...............................................
H. (Dentigera) luna
sp. nov.

- Penis valves in dorsal view largely approximate, no spines thus visible from above between penis valves, ventral projections usually short and broad, not spine-like.......................................................................18

18. S8 with extremely elongated, curved, slender apical process, its apex with pair of hair tufts ( Fig. 4 ); S6 emarginate in middle; thorax, particularly mesepisterna, strikingly coarsely and strongly punctuate; S7 with apical lobe reduced, slender, pointed, with sparse hairs.................
H . (Nesoprosopis) floralis (Smith)

- S8 rhombic, with short, rounded or truncate, hairless apical process; S6 not emarginated; thorax usually finely punctuate; S7 with apical lobe reduced, compact, with hairs that may be short and sparse [subgenus
H. ( Prosopis )
Fabricius]............................................................................................................................19

2. Marks on paraocular area often elongate, contiguous with inner orbit ...........
H . (Dentigera) luna
sp. nov.

3. Underside of flagellum brown, upper width of clypeus: maximum clypeal width more than 0.5 ................ .............................................................................................................
H. (Lambdopsis) medialis Morawitz

- Underside of flagellum yellow, upper width of clypeus: maximum clypeal width less than 0.5.................. ............................................................................................................
H. (Lambdopsis) pfankuchi (Alfken)

4. Facial fovea elongate, somewhat surpassing upper ocular margin, converging strongly toward ocelli, terminating closer to ocelli than to eye ( Fig. 5 ) [subgenus H. (Paraprosopis) Popov]...................................5

5. Marks on pronotal collar and pronotal lobe yellow; punctures on mesopleuron sparser than those on mesoscutum ...............................................................................
H. (Paraprosopis) nigricallosus Morawitz

- Pronotal collar and pronotal lobe wholly black; punctures on mesopleuron like those on mesoscutum ...... ........................................................................................................
H. (Paraprosopis) concinnus Cockerell

6. Mesepisternum with strikingly coarse and strong but regular pitlike punctures; T1 without lateral fringe.. ........ ........................................................................................................
H . (Nesoprosopis) floralis (Smith)

- Mesepisternum with fine punctures or, if coarse and strong, then not regular and metasomal terga densely punctuates; T1 often with lateral fringe.......................................................................................................7

7. Larger species (body length 5–9mm ) usually with short head; facial fovea usually with upper end well separated from eye; propodeum short, at least lateral and posterior surfaces mostly rounded, not delimited by carinae, with fine sculpture and covered with white feltlike hairs; T1 often with lateral fringe of white hairs, but if fringe absent, then metasomal base sometimes red [subgenus
H. ( Prosopis )
Fabricius].........8

- Smaller species (body length 3.5–8.0mm) with elongated head; facial fovea shorter, upper end close to eye margin; propodeum usually sharp-edged or with carina around posterior surface; metasoma black, usually without lateral fringe on T1, but if T1 has fringe, then mesepisternum densely, finely punctuate and propodeum rounded, with fine sculpture [subgenus
H. ( Hylaeus )
Fabricius]......................................9

9. Preoccipital ridge very sharp ...............................................................
H. (Hylaeus) difformis (Eversmann)

10. Scutellum with two spots; T1 and T2 often red...................................
H. (Hylaeus ) przewalskyi Morawitz
- Hairs on metasomal terga short, fine and sparse, not forming hair-bands.................................................14

15. Two small spots on clypeus, marks on paraocular area drip-like; apical marginal zones of T2 to T6 brownish black .......................................................................................................
H. (Hylaeus) sibiricus (Strand)

- A longitudinal stripe on clypeus, marks on paraocular area well developed; apical marginal zones of T2 to T6 wide and bright...............................................................................
H. (Hylaeus) asiaticus (Dalla Torre)
- Marks on paraocular area triangular, subtriangular or irregular................................................................18

18. Marks on paraocular area not reaching the level of the lower margin of the antennal socket ...................... ..............................................................................................................
H. (Hylaeus) fuliginosus (Warncke)

19. Head length: head width less than one; marks on paraocular area clearly extending above the level of the lower margin of the antennal socket; white apical spot of hind tibia inconspicuous .................................... ...................................................................................................................
H. (Hylaeus) potanini Morawitz

- Head length: head width more than one; marks on paraocular area reaching the level of the lower margin of the antennal socket but not above it; apex of hind tibia black ..............
H. (Hylaeus) perforatus (Smith)
